action.action-desc: Mr. Kennedy of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To provide for the awarding of the Purple Heart to certain veterans who experienced a traumatic brain injury, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Staff Sergeant John D. Martek Purple Heart Restoration Act.

section.header: Awarding of Purple Heart to Certain Veterans Who Experienced a Traumatic Brain Injury
section.text: Chapter 57 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1129a the following new section:

section.header: Purple Heart: certain veterans who experienced a traumatic brain injury

subsection.text: For purposes of the award of the Purple Heart, the Secretary concerned shall treat a veteran described in subsection (b) in the same manner as a member of the Armed Forces who is killed or wounded in action as the result of an act of an enemy of the United States.
A veteran described in this subsection is a veteran—

paragraph.text: who experienced a traumatic brain injury while a member of the Armed Forces that is attributable to an act of an enemy of the United States that occurred on or after December 7, 1941; and

subparagraph.text: who has a service-connected disability attributable to such traumatic brain injury, as determined by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or
with respect to whom there is a military record that demonstrates the occurrence of such traumatic brain injury.

paragraph.text: establish a process for persons to submit applications for the awarding of the Purple Heart under this section; and

award the Purple Heart to each person who submits an application that demonstrates the person is a veteran described in subsection (b), without regard to the date on which the veteran experienced the traumatic brain injury that is described in the application.

subsection.text: In this section, the terms service-connected and veteran have the meaning given the terms in section 101 of title 38.
